intro: Psychotria subspathulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often consumed by birds and other wildlife. Psychotria subspathulata is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses in traditional medicine.
